ca.uqac.lif.cep

Interface Function

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Addition, BinaryFunction, CumulativeFunction, Division, IsGreaterThan, Multiplication, Power, Subtraction, UnaryFunction

    public interface Function
extends Cloneable
    Represents a stateless m-to-n function.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int s_maxInputArity
      The maximum input arity that a computable can have

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Function clone()
      Creates a copy of the function
      Object[] compute(Object[] inputs)
      Computes the outputs of the function, given some inputs
      int getInputArity()
      Gets the function's input arity, i.e.
      int getOutputArity()
      Gets the function's output arity, i.e.
      void reset()
      Resets the function to its initial state.

    • Field Detail

      • s_maxInputArity

        static final int s_maxInputArity
        The maximum input arity that a computable can have
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        Object[] compute(Object[] inputs)
        Computes the outputs of the function, given some inputs
        Parameters:
        inputs - The arguments of the function. The size of the array should be equal to the function's declared input arity.
        Returns:
        The outputs of the function. The size of the array returned should be equal to the function's declared output arity.

      • getInputArity

        int getInputArity()
        Gets the function's input arity, i.e. the number of arguments it takes.
        Returns:
        The input arity

      • getOutputArity

        int getOutputArity()
        Gets the function's output arity, i.e. the number of elements it outputs. (We expect that most functions will have an output arity of 1.)
        Returns:
        The output arity

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the function to its initial state. In the case of a stateless function, nothing requires to be done.

      • clone

        Function clone()
        Creates a copy of the function
        Returns:
        The copy
